Director of Public Prosecutions.translat: in the legal system of England and Wales, the lawyer whose job it is to decide whether or not a person should be charged with a crime, in cases where it is not clear. There is a similar official in Scotland called the procurator fiscal.
in England, an important official who advises the government on legal subjects and decides which cases should go before a court of law
A file was sent to the Director of Public Prosecutions, but the DPP decided not to press charges against the individuals concerned.
